pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:0.4: 12. The training rule on bad behavior
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.2: At that time the nuns who were pupils of the nun Thullanandā were constantly socializing, were behaving badly, and had a bad reputation, and they were harassing the Sangha of nuns and hiding one another’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.3: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.4: “How can those nuns constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns are acting like this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.8: How can nuns constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.11: ‘If nuns constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.12: then the nuns should correct them in this way:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.13: “Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.14: Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.15: If those nuns still continue as before, the nuns should press them up to three times to make them stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.16: If they then stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:1.17: If not, then those nuns too have committed a third-time offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.2: what is meant is that they are fully ordained.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.4: they constantly socialize with improper bodily and verbal action.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.8: a bad reputation has spread about them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.10: they make a living by means of a bad and wrong livelihood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.12: they object on each other’s behalf when legal procedures are being carried out against them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.18: Other nuns, those who see it or hear about it. They should say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.19: “Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.20: Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.21: And they should say this a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.23: If they stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.24: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.25: If those who heard about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.26: Those nuns, even if they have to be dragged into the middle of the Sangha, should be spoken to thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.27: “Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.28: Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.29: They should say this a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.31: If they stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.32: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.34: “And, monks, they should be pressed in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.35: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.36: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.37: The nuns so-and-so and so-and-so constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.39: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should press them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.41: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.42: The nuns so-and-so and so-and-so constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.44: The Sangha presses them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.45: Any nun who approves of pressing them to make them stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.46: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.47: For the second time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.48: For the third time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.49: The nuns so-and-so and so-and-so have been pressed by the Sangha to make them stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.50: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.51: After the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.52: After each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.53: When the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.54: If they commit the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.55: Two or three may be pressed at once, but not more than that.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.57: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.59: there is an offense when they have been pressed for the third time, not as soon as the misconduct has been committed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.61: they are sent away from the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.1.63: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.2.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as legitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.2.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.2.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.2.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.2.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.2.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as illegitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.3.2: if she has not been pressed;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss12:2.3.6: The twelfth offense entailing suspension is finished.
